message.content:
cs.CV, cs.MM, cs.HC, cs.IT, cs.LG 

This paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category as it deals with face recognition using thermal infrared imaging. The paper also mentions the use of active appearance models (AAMs) which are commonly used in computer vision applications. 

The paper may also belong to the multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category as it deals with image processing and analysis. 

The human-computer interaction (cs.HC) sub-category is also a possibility as the paper discusses the challenges of facial expression recognition and normalization. 

The information theory (cs.IT) sub-category may be relevant as the paper discusses the use of ensemble methods to improve face recognition accuracy. 

Finally, the machine learning (cs.LG) sub-category may also be relevant as the paper discusses the development of a person-specific representation robust to transient changes in facial temperature emissions.
